verbose_text: In response to TGF-beta, type 1 (ALKs 1-7 in humans) and type 2 receptors (ActR-IIA, ActR-IIB, BMPR-II, AMHR-II and TbR-II, in humans) form complexes and the constitutively active type 2 serine/threonine kinase phosphorylates the type 1 receptor.
evidence: type 2 receptors (ActR-IIA, ActR-IIB, BMPR-II, AMHR-II and TbR-II, in humans) form complexes and the constitutively active type 2 serine/threonine kinase phosphorylates the type 1 receptor
